001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004/**
005 * <h2 id=configuration>Configuration</h2>
006 *
007 * <h3>ApiRoot and ProjectApiRoot</h3>
008 *
009 * <p>The SDK modules provide an ApiRootBuilder to create an {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiHttpClient}. To ease the development
010 * the builder can also create a module specific ApiRoot or ProjectApiRoot. E.g.: {@link com.commercetools.api.client.ApiRoot}
011 * and {@link com.commercetools.api.client.ProjectApiRoot}
012 * </p>
013 * <p>Creating http requests starts from the ApiRoot which  holds information specific to the project. The following example
014 * shows how to configure an API root and a project scoped root:</p>
015 *
016 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#instance()}
017 *
018 * <p>Similar configuration to create the root instances for the Import API</p>
019 *
020 * {@include.example example.ImportExamplesTest#instance()}
021 *
022 * <h3>Custom HTTP client</h3>
023 *
024 * <p>The builder can be instantiated with a custom {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.VrapHttpClient} instance. For example a
025 * specific instance of a client</p>
026 *
027 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#customHttpClient()}
028 *
029 * <p>This can also be useful to wrap preconfigured clients e.g. with additional middlewares</p>
030 *
031 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#wrappedClient()}
032 */
033public class Configuration {
034}
